name: Talisman (II)
description:
digital sculpture for AR, 2021

A prelude. Radical change comes from radical empathy.

This digital sculpture will rotate for normal displays. It is also interactive, allowing users to digitally alter landscapes, personal or public. 

This small series presents talismans for the future. 


Short biography:
Taking cues from 19th-century landscape painting, 20th-century cinema, and 21st-century planetary research, Kelly Richardson crafts digital works which offer imaginative glimpses of the future that prompt a careful consideration of the present.
 
Richardson’s work has been featured in the Beijing, Busan, Canadian, Gwangju and Montréal biennales, as well as major moving image exhibitions internationally, including TIFF and Sundance Film Festival. Her works are represented in the collections of the Hirshhorn Museum and Sculpture Garden (USA), SMoCA (USA), Albright-Knox Art Gallery (USA), National Gallery of Canada, Art Gallery of Ontario, Musée d’art contemporain de Montréal, Arts Council Collection (England), Southampton City Art Gallery (England), Towner (England), Arts Council Collection (England), among others.
